job_title: RN Med/Surg in Kansas City, MO
pros: When I initially started working at TMC it was a great place. The culture is very laid back and diverse. Despite being short staffed it was still a fun place to work. You will learn a lot and will become a very skilled clinician. This is a good teaching hospital for a new nurse to build their clinical skills and confidence.
cons: Executive leadership makes new policies without much thought to them. When these new policies back fire then it is quickly swept under the rug. The CNO gives off a cold and standoff vibe, she never speaks or greets staff when doing rounds. Patients with aggressive behavior basically get away with doing or saying what they want to staff without any form of repercussions (ex: A patient assaulted a pregnant nurse and he was not discharged). Also emails are sent out from the PR team on behalf of the executive leadership that come off as condescending. We all understand about wearing a mask but my goodness TMC is obsessive with it and will send it in an email everyday (like we get it).

job_title: Pharmacy Intern in Kansas City, MO

review_title: Formally known as Truman Medical centers

job_title: Registered Nurse in Kansas City, MO

review_title: Stable work environment, but management isn't very receptive to employee feedback
job_title: Mental Health Technician in Kansas City, MO
pros: Fairly stable work environment, pay differentials, benefits even for "full-time" employees that only work weekends
cons: Management is not very receptive to employee feedback, pay determined almost exclusively by seniority within the organization rather than education level or work performance. Within my team, several of the primary care staff members are more qualified than our managers to be in positions of leadership, but workplace politics have made promotions difficult for those more qualified primary care staff members. Management seems to treat the group homes more like businesses than mental health treatment facilities. Also, our team has been short staffed for nearly a full year, now, and although the job duties of the open positions are still being completed by the remaining staff members, we have not received any compensation for the increased workload.

job_title: Environmental Services Director in Kansas City, MO

job_title: Staff RN in Kansas City, MO
pros: Administration out of touch. You will probably never get fired no matter what you do. Free healthcare for employees if you can manage to get any appointments, but whether or not you get a skilled provider is a different story altogether.
cons: Low pay. No ancillary staff whatsoever. Employees seem to work on an honor system so some do their job and are helpful but others make more work for everyone else. When the hospital does have funds to pay bonuses etc, they generally use those for other things like new curtains in the rooms or new beds when the old ones are sufficient and what we are lacking is staff. No breaks including lunch breaks. Rarely any unit clerks or anyone else to answer telephones and call lights. Occasionally bonuses will be given out but not to everyone. There will be some odd category that they choose to exclude, and the bonuses are so rare as to be virtually non-existent anyway.

review_title: A company that genuinely cares about the patients and the community.
job_title: QUALIFIED MENTAL HEALTH PROFESSIONAL in Kansas City, MO
pros: I feel very well supported by my supervisors and they understand community and it's needs. They've helped me to grow and allowed me to incorporate my passions into my work. The leadership I interact with in Behavioral Health is on point. One of the best benefits is that any medical service you have done at Truman is free - they wave the co-pay and deductible. Need a CT scan? Free. Have a baby? Free. After a year of working in certain jobs within the Behavioral Health department you are eligible for a program called Career Ladder in which you select things that you will do above and beyond your current job - then six months after showing that you are doing them, you get either a 3% raise or a 7%-10% raise depending on how many things you select to do.
cons: Everything I would complain about it rather petty and program specific. The one major thing is that our annual cost-of-living increase you get at your performance review is low (typically it's 3%). It's been 1%-1.5% for the last couple of years. It all depends on how the budget looks. They typically announce it sometime towards the end of the fiscal year. Word on the street is that we may get a 2.5% this year, but it's not clear and I won't be holding my breath.

job_title: Registered Respiratory Therapist in Kansas City, MO

job_title: Medical Coder in Kansas City, MO

job_title: Clinic Administration in Kansas City, MO
pros: Super generous PTO from the very beginning. Outstanding insurance.
cons: Their pay is below city/national standards for a positions here. A position here, will get paid less than an identical position in another hospital.

job_title: QUALIFIED MENTAL HEALTH PROFESSIONAL in Kansas City, MO
pros: Being a safety net hospital if your heart is to serve the underprivileged, this is one place to do so. Overall, a pleasant workforce. Nice, down to earth employees.
cons: It all depends on what you're looking for. The hospital has a lot of turn over and it seems to me that it is a result of an outdated organizational culture. There is little room for innovation, risk taking, and therefore growth both for an employee as for the organization as a whole. Superficial support later translates into red tape. If you're looking for a stable career with no growth, just your basic 9-5, this could be for you. Not so for me.

job_title: Director in Kansas City, MO
pros: Caring, friendly co-workers and patients.  Outstanding clinicians. One of the most professional, creative, well-educated teams with which I have ever worked in over 25 years of professional work.  Competitive salaries, excellent benefits. Proud to work here and walk the halls every day and to represent TMC in the greater KC community. Primary teaching hospital.  Value professional development.
cons: Misinformed public perception of what and who TMC is.  This limits our ability to recruit and serve more people with our quality care.

review_title: Good to know you're doing something special when you go to work
job_title: Contact Center Patient Access Representative in Kansas City, MO
pros: good pay for the customer service industry, great health benefits, dedicated to patient-care and doing what's right.
cons: Favortism is somewhat of a problem now and then. While Truman is working to extend it's reach to all in the community, the majority of our patients are from low income situations. This translates to a variety of issues you might run into with each patient you assist.

review_title: Prepare to work  LOTS of OT if you're a SW with no compensation
job_title: Social Worker in Kansas City, MO
pros: Great benefits (medical, mainly). Good 401K company match.
cons:
Change in SW directors has shifted priorities from meeting patient needs to focusing on strict adherence to arrival time despite having to work 10 hours every day (even if you're salaried, you'd better be there by 8 AM). Very high stress and little recognition of this from SW directors. 

PTO must be used for major holidays. Obvious favoritism of a few employees by department directors.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Kansas City, MO
pros: The patients were great to get to know. It was an honor to care for and serve them.
cons: Toxic/bullying work environment; constant drama between staff; management is horrible and made conflicts worse; don't report problems to management-you will be blamed and labeled a trouble-maker. Many staff like to do nothing (on cell phones and Facebook) and still collect a paycheck. The patients deserve better.

job_title: Surgical Technician in Kansas City, MO
pros: They have education assistance and the pay is pretty good.  Also there is,  within the right department with the right people /manager supporting you.
cons: Some managers are not very good.  Sometimes when wanting to move to a different department it's difficult.  Seems like they don't care or meet your needs as an employee.  It's also very difficult to get on at Truman.  You have to know people or get in contact with the right people to get an interview or to get on at Truman.

review_title: Not bad but certainly not the worse place to work for.
job_title: End User Computing Specialist
pros: The people.  Simple as that, the people there are incredible!  I worked there in IT for almost 10 years and when I left felt like I left a good portion of myself there.  The benefits were not too bad.
cons: Senior management really did not interact nor engage the lower ranks of the hospital.  I got the feeling that we were there servicing them half the time.

job_title: Coordinator in Kansas City, MO
pros: Pretty decent environment. Leadership asks for feedback and ideas to be better. Good paid time off, and gets better with tenure. Really good insurance.
cons: Pay is below national, and city standards. Too often, people with a poor attitude are onboard, which perpetuates a little bit of a rough patient experience.

job_title: RN in Kansas City, MO
pros: Diverse patient population, nursing experience, exposure to advanced skills, on boarding for new grad nurses, benefits.
cons: Downtown, lots of newer nurses, RN turnover, shifting priorities of leadership, financial challenges.  At times can be challenging to work with so many medical students and residents.

review_title: As a Licensed Qualified Mental Health Professional I work with people struggling with chronic MI, SA, & homelessness.
job_title: Licensed Qualified Mental Health Professional in Kansas City, MO
pros: Good pay. Monday-Friday 8-4:30pm. Ability to independently manage my own caseload. Advocacy for an extremely vulnerable population.
cons: Its an inpatient/hospital setting, so I work some holidays as well as the day before and after Thanksgiving & Christmas (pending no prn coverage). Unpaid overtime often required due to the volume and intensity of the work.

review_title: Great place to get into the healthcare industry
job_title: Patient Accounts Supervisor in Kansas City, MO
pros: My director gives advancement and educational opportunities to those who want to advance or broaden their knowledge.  This individual has proven to be results driven which requires the entire staff to meet standards and learn new concepts which is great.
cons: Lack of numerous resources with credibility is not always available.  It seems to be that everyone is out to cover themselves at all times.

job_title: Medical Professional in Kansas City, MO
pros:
in the beginning, it seems like the company may care about you.
If you want to just "put in your time to collect a paycheck" then this could be the place for you
cons: the longer you work there the less you find the professional support you need.  Transferring out of what you think may have become an apathetic department does not necessarily result in hospital change of attitude.

job_title: Registered Nurse in Kansas City, MO
pros: Teaching hospital. Diverse employee and patient base.  Nurses are nice to each other for the most part. Level 1 trauma center. You see many things and get good working knowledge. Great benefits.  Supportive environment!
cons: Personally, I was told things in the interview that did not come to pass and were changed after hired. Daily equipment is frequently not working.  Some of the PCT's don't do their jobs which increases work load.

review_title: Backstabbing, unqualified supervisory ppl will fabricate problems and probably violate Fed laws.
job_title: I T in Kansas City, MO
pros: Previously had good medical insurance. If you are an insider, and preferably female, you can work few hours and be paid well. If you are a middle aged man, forget it.
cons: The doctors do not work for the hospital, but rather another organization (it is a teaching hospital). Too many rogue & unqualified supervisory ppl. HR is a bad joke, and evals are inconsistent and unhelpful.

job_title: Unit Clerk in Kansas City, MO
pros: I love working at Truman, the pay is competitive, benefits are great. One may never find a job well everyone is perfect. But those are learning moments. Overall it is a great place to work. It will teach one how to adjust to diversity and cultural differences.
cons: Some of the patients are very rude and mean to staff. But I can't control anyone else's behavior. I can however control how I respond to patients and not take it personal.

review_title: "Where have all the leaders gone",  best Lee Iacocca Quote
job_title: Medical Offices Staff in Kansas City, MO
pros: Increased share value, increased board and corporate bonuses
cons: Decreased number of employees with consistent annual cycles without raises and possible job loss and early voluntary job exit programs that began with employees’ having  25 years or more of service then 15 years of service and in 2014 the 10 years of service or group.

review_title: Great place to work and receive care
job_title: Registered Nurse in Kansas City, MO
pros: -Diversity among staff and patients, continued learning as we care for many people who have multiple co-morbidities, we provide compassionate care to anyone that walks in our doors.  We are a teaching hospital and have the capability to help shape the future leaders in healthcare.
cons: At times we're understaffed, which creates stress among the team.

job_title: Staff RN in Kansas City, MO
pros:
I work in the Emergency Department and have never had a "Dull" day. 
Great team of doctors and nurses with good communication (there is no filter)
Great teaching hospital
cons:
There is a lot of busy work and frustrating patients.
There is legitimate danger working in the department 
It has been known to get pretty stressful

review_title: The patient population is ever changing and keeps you on your toes.
job_title: RN, Bsn in Kansas City, MO
pros: Patient population is very diverse and in need of healthcare,  education and emotional support that I enjoy providing.  Lots of chances for learning.
cons: Teamwork and support of staff is lacking.  Set up of current computer system doesn't support nurses in caring for all patients on the unit.  Insufficient medical service availability on nights and weekends for a hospital of this size.

job_title: Residency Program Coordinator in Kansas City, MO
pros: Working as an administrative leader directly with physician directors in graduate medical education and being able to consistently improve processes and maximize potential.
cons: Professional development is encouraged, but advancement and management or succession training does not consistently happen. I see employees leave for other opportunities, and then get hired back after they have progressed elsewhere.

review_title: The Right Tools but Needs Better Execution
job_title: in Kansas City, MO
pros: Most are talented and dedicated employees and are willing to fulfill their care of patients.  They have specialists that are the best and most experienced in the city.
cons: Complex professional and facility arrangement makes rapid and needed change challenging.  Others have become ingrained in their way of doing things that worked decades ago.

review_title: An excellent place to practice medical social work.

pros: The Social Work department is still run by social workers, not by nurses, which is not the case for most other hosptals in the area.  Very supportive supervisor and director.
cons: Working with the population that frequents the hospital can be emotionally demanding at times.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Kansas City, MO
pros: Really great people and knowledgeable co-workers.  IT Department tended not to micro-manage.  So as long as you get your work done, no one seemed to care if you were in the office or not.
cons: Not a lot of opportunities to move up in the org.  Pay raises aren't very much.  However, that may change since they are becoming a Cerner ITWorks client.

review_title: Provided a good living for many years

cons: Service workers in the organization did not seem to reflect the dedication demonstrated by the professional staff.

job_title: Coordinator in Kansas City, MO
pros: Wonderful health benefits!! Wonderful small team, no complaints. I like everyone here, everyone is super nice. My boss is honest and passionate about what she does for the community. I feel respected and important here. My job allows me to challenge myself and be creative.
cons: Sometimes there are weekend events, but my boss is always willing to let me go early another day during the next week! So not really any cons!

review_title: Truman Medical center needs to help employee's more.

pros:
The benifits are great compaired to other hospitals. 
Flexabliity in time needed off are reasonable.
cons:
Performance - extra work are noticed, but not mentioned that you did a good job, or thank you for taking it apon yourself for doing that.
Pay I feel is under the cost of living level.- Needs a new cost of living raise. Last one was 5-7 yrs ago.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Kansas City, MO
pros: Good health care benefits, especially if you don't mind seeing Truman doctors at Truman locations. Many of my co-workers really do care about helping people.
cons: Upper management has no idea what's really going on. They are all about appearances and don't really care if the work is being done. Parking is terrible.

job_title: Registered Nurse in Kansas City, MO
pros: Teamwork approach, coworkers become like family, very diverse environment, supportive and flexible leadership, hiring opportunities for new nurses, opportunities for advancement.
cons: Older facility, teaching hospital atmosphere which translates to ongoing preceptorship of new nurses and students (which can become tiresome), lower funding for necessary supplies, staffing consistency and adequacy.

job_title: Recovery Coach in Kansas City, MO
pros: Awesome flexibility, PTO, good environment and supportive staff, room for growth, a lot of opportunities internally. A lot of benefits come with the gig. Raises each yr and bonus checks
cons: I've heard we get paid a little low but now I am hearing different. Think we get paid accordingly. Not many cons

review_title: Truman Medical Center is an overall good health care provider for the community.
job_title: Senior Social Worker in Kansas City, MO
pros: GOOD health benefits must stay with Truman system.  My supervisor and director of my department were supportive during a health care issue. I like the weekly farmers market. Truman strives to provide quality health care and access to healthcare for the community. Good working environment.
cons: High volume of people with needs.

review_title: My job is rewarding and I love coming to work everyday.
job_title: Medical Assistant Oncology Center in Kansas City, MO
pros: We help the less fortunate.
cons: Working with people who should not have got into healthcare.

review_title: Assists to help our community's most acute population.
job_title: QMHP in Westwood Hills, KS
pros: The benefits are a perk, especially if you have a family or intend on having one.  All is done in house.
cons: They have a lower pay scale compared to other area hospitals.  Market rate adjustment was completed, but not distributed fairly.

job_title: RN Staff Nurse in Kansas City, MO
pros: Pay, health insurance, education assistance and opportunity to care for underserved populations.
cons: Leadership has no consistency as an organization.  Need more action and less talk from top leadership.

job_title: Lab Technician in Kansas City, MO
pros: The benefits are wonderful. Also it's a non-profit organization, so you can use the PSLF to have school loans forgiven after 10 years
cons: The yearly raise stinks. Also, its extremely difficult to get a promotion

job_title: Patient Representative in Kansas City, MO
pros: Good hours, flexible time off, team/family feel. Benefits are great for employees.  Overtime is offered as well as company paid holidays
cons: Unorganized and  buildings need updated. Very inner city. Lots of homeless more PTO should be granted. Overworked employees because there is a high need for staff.

job_title: Patient Access Representative in Kansas City, MO
pros: They have wonderful benefits and a lot of opportunity to advance.
cons: The patient population could be a little rough sometimes. This problem unfortunately caused  a lot of turnover and or nurse's who have been burnout for years and needed a change of scenery.

job_title: Financial Coordinator in Kansas City, MO
pros: Great benefits. Loved the patients. Good medical care.
cons: Little room for advancement. Minorities are shown favortism.

job_title: Senior Employment Specialist in Roeland Park, KS
pros: Decent health benefits and positive, helpful team of co-workers.
cons: Bonus structure changed various times and inconsistent with guidelines for pay.  Lack of training to support employees and emphasis on numbers rather than quality of training and interaction with consumers. High turnover.

review_title: Fulfilling work in an awesome company
job_title: Recovery Coach in Kansas City, MO

-AMAZING behavioral health services (arguably best in the state)
-Room for lateral position changes and upward mobility
-Tuition Reimbursement
-Occasional bonuses 
-Great benefits and fair PTO
cons: -Challenging work at times with the population we serve

review_title: I loved working at TMC. The mission of the organization was genuine. Very competitive benefits and pay.
job_title: Managed Care Coordinator in Kansas City, MO
